values.text: Is there anything else I can help you with?
Thank you.. I am glad , am able to help you

1.	Introduction to ROP
The Rapid Open Provisioning (ROP) portal is a website that allows you to provide IBM with information with which to set up your Intel / Client Server environment.  ROP accepts data regarding UCS Blades (e.g. compute resources), legacy physical servers (e.g. IBM 3850s and HPDL), VDI workplace and tape library requirements.  

Using ROP you create a "project" and specify your recovery data, submitting it so that IBM has it for disaster recovery exercises and at time of disaster, similar to having information on file with IBM in the form of a worksheet.  The advantage of using ROP is that it allows IBM Resiliency Services to employ automations to deploy the project and build the recovery environment quickly, giving our customers a faster RPO.  

Benefits of ROP:
	ROP portal provides you the ability to input and manage an Intel event configuration via a web portal.
	ROP transforms the way we deliver our services to you by automating the provisioning of ESXi, Windows, Linux, vCenter Servers and VMs on CISCO UCS Servers.
	ROP also allows you to include Non-UCS Servers and equipment, such as Legacy Servers  IBM3850 and HPDL, VDI Workplace and Tape Library into your project.
	The provisioning of services can be performed without manual intervention or the risk of configuration errors leading to performance issues or system failures during event of disaster. 
	Customization of basic client server configuration such as hostname, service profile, network configuration and SVC SAN disk are automatically performed via UCS workflow.
	 System builds can be completely standardised, incorporating best practices. 

2.	Accessing the ROP customer portal:
Each ROP user has to have an IBM ID.  If you do not already have one, please register for an ID at www.IBM.com.  Typically, you use your regular organizations email address as your IBM ID.    After obtaining an IBM ID, contact your SDPA and provide the first and last name and the IBM ID of each person you wish to have access to ROP for your organization.  Once this has been completed you can log in to the portal and create a recovery project.  This project is saved in the database for future retrieval or modification.  Once submitted, an IBM admin can login in to the portal and approve or modify the recovery project and submit it for automated provisioning.

This is the ROP URL:  https://ropus.mybluemix.net

For existing clients who previously filled out an IBM Intel workbook, we are retiring the workbook altogether in favour of using ROP, which will accept all data that used to be placed on the workbook. The portal is easy to use and the always on nature of the portal encourages you to keep the data inside "recovery ready" as well as using it to give IBM testing configuration requirements. It also eliminates the need for IBM to make, and you to review and approve, setup documentation.  The info you put in the portal is "wysiwyg" and IBM will build according to it, no setup documents required.  You are encouraged to use ROP in place of filling out an Intel workbook as we will be retiring the Intel workbook at the end of 2020 and no longer accepting it for test preparation in 2021.

Service Delivery Program Advisor( SDPA) :
SDPA is a primary focal between the Customer, Account management, Technical team of Resiliency Service Delivery .
 SDPA on a day to day support activities including pre-exercise preparation, technical QA's, scheduling, problem resolution, and recovery exercise support.
Responsible for providing professional, specialized skills including workforce, workplace and technology Resiliency planning, Project Management, Risk management, and Testing oversight. 
Assisting Clients/Project Office in facilitating and coordinating Resiliency Services -  Development, implementation, and maintenance of Resiliency Solutions.     
	Supports the execution of Resiliency Exercises
	Contributes to the implementation of relevant policies and procedures facilitating an effective Resiliency Service program aligned with the goals and objectives of the company, the business units, and the shareholders. 
	Coordinate the activities necessary for an exercise or outage/emergency.
	Scheduling a customer's DR exercises
	Setting up the pretest calls -  Coordination,  take notes on the overall call and follow up items.  
	Coordinate with Technical Towers on understanding and building the DR solutions/systems setup/documentation
Coordinate setup document exchange with customer/Account Team and work to gain customer agreement on document accuracy.
Toward the conclusion of the exercise, understand how the test is going if it will end on time, or require an extension.  If the extension is required, coordinate following IBM RS processes (verify equipment, confirm costs, gain internal approvals, gain external approvals for cost, etc).  
After exercise, conduct/coordinate post-test activities, Perform close-out activities - Complete exercise notes.  
	Bill exercise hours.
	Daily Reporting to Management on the Status of the Resiliency Projects and Financial implications for approvals and more.

How One Time Charges (OTC) works?

When a client requests equipment or services that are not in their contract and there is not enough time to process a contract upgrade. These items must be added to the contract to ensure the client is recovery ready. Refer to the Customer Support Team Room Database. Under Process and Procedures  One Time Charge Process
Steps are: Fill Out OTC Pricing Request form and forward to assign PAs at your site to create a work authorization. Copy: IBM RS Upgrades Database

A One Time Charge will be generated for the requested services.
After receiving client approval for the price and scope, a Work Authorization for Additional Services will be generated and sent to you.  
Review the document for accuracy, send to the client for signature, and countersign the Work Authorization.  Only an IBM employee can countersign the document.
After the client and IBM signatures have been obtained, scan the Work Authorization and store in COMDOC as SALES - Letter of Authorization.  For IGA Accounts, an email approval of the Work Authorization is acceptable.  Please generate a PDF of the email and store it in COMDOC as above.

Welcome team: My name is SquadNagi, I am created to assist you to access and explore the content available in the Service Delivery Program Advisor(SDPA) Account Operational Manual. You may ask anything relevant here. 

-  One Time Charges (OTC)
-  Service Request Tool (SRT)
-  Rapid Ops Provisioning (ROP)
-  Emergency Operations Center(EOC)
-  Event Extension Process / T-10 
-  Interactive Resiliency Portal (IRP)
-   Staffing Approval Request Tool (RPE)
-   PRISM ( Scheduling Tool)
